org.opentcs.data

Class TCSObjectEventFilter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.opentcs.data.TCSObjectEventFilter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, EventFilter<TCSEvent>
    Deprecated. 
    EventFilter is deprecated.

    @Deprecated
 @ScheduledApiChange(when="5.0",
                    details="Will be removed.")
public class TCSObjectEventFilter
extends java.lang.Object
implements EventFilter<TCSEvent>, java.io.Serializable
    A filter for TCSObjectEvents.

    A TCSObjectEventFilter accepts TCSObjectEvents only; other events are never accepted.

    A TCSObjectEventFilter uses two criteria to check if a TCSObjectEvent is acceptable or not - the name of the object associated with the event and the name of that object's implementing class. For each of the two a Pattern is defined, and every event will be checked against these.

    Any of the two Patterns may be null, meaning that matching based on the respective attribute is not wanted. That is, if the pattern for class name matching is null, only the object names have to match; if the pattern for object name matching is null, only the class names have to match. By default, events are not accepted, so if both the pattern for class name matching and the one for object name matching are null, all events will be refused.

    Instances of this class are immutable and can safely be used by concurrent threads.

    See Also:

      • TCSObjectEventFilter

        public TCSObjectEventFilter(java.util.regex.Pattern acceptedClassNames,
                            java.util.regex.Pattern acceptedObjectNames)
        Deprecated. 
        Creates a new TCSObjectEventFilter with the given parameters. Note that, if both parameters are null, the filter will not accept any event.
        Parameters:
        acceptedClassNames - A Pattern for matching names of classes of the objects associated with events. May be null to express that matching based on the class name is not wanted.
        acceptedObjectNames - A Pattern for matching names of the objects associated with events. May be null to express that matching based on the object name is not wanted.
